thread.title: Shia LaBeouf & Jaden Smith Begin 4-Year Live Stream In Protest Of Trump
thread.title_full: Shia LaBeouf & Jaden Smith Begin 4-Year Live Stream In Protest Of Trump

author: Angus Walker
title: Shia LaBeouf & Jaden Smith Begin 4-Year Live Stream In Protest Of Trump

organizations.name: trump home > society > shia labeouf & jaden smith begin

text:
Home > Society > Shia LaBeouf & Jaden Smith Begin 4-Year Live Stream In Protest Of Trump Shia LaBeouf & Jaden Smith Begin 4-Year Live Stream In Protest Of Trump 0 0 0 Posted by Angus Walker , Jan 20, 2017 at 02:39pm The two celebrity visionaries have begun day one of a four-year protest of our new commander in chief. 
Whenever Shia LaBeouf embarks on a live streaming event, one can expect it to be a massive undertaking. You may remember when he live-streamed himself and a rotating group of fans watching all of his movies in reverse chronological order for three days straight. His latest, in response to today's inauguration of Donald Trump, is an even bolder stunt. He launched the "He Will Not Divide Us" live stream this morning at 9 AM. He plans to keep it live for the next four years. 
The event has begun and thus far remained at the Museum of the Moving Image in New York. And LaBeouf had a celebrity friend stand in front of the camera to start the stream. Over five hours later, Jaden Smith is still front and center, now backed by a sizable crowd, and he continues to repeat the same five words: "He will not divide us." 
It's unclear how the stream will proceed for the next 1,459 days, but it's off to a promising start. Tune in below.
